All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AlreadyExistingPlayerException
This exception is thrown when a player is already in the game.
AlreadyMaxNumberOfPlayersException
This exception is thrown when the maximum number of players in a game is reached.
AlreadyThreeCardsInHandException
This exception is thrown when a player tries to draw a card when he already has three cards in his hand.
Angle
This class represents an angle of a card.
AngleAlreadyLinkedException
This exception is thrown when a player tries to link an angle that is already linked.
AngleOrientation
This enumeration represents the orientation of an angle.
AngleStatus
This enumeration represents the status of an angle.
AppTest
Unit test for simple App.
AsyncReader
This class is responsible for asynchronously reading user input.
Card
This class represents a generic card, uniquely identified by an id and a side.
CardFactory<T>
This is an abstract class that represents a generic card factory.
CardFactoryTest
 
CardHandler
This class is responsible for handling the cards of the game.
CardHandlerTest
 
CardInfo
Is the class that contains all card information needed during the game
CardNotFoundException
This exception is thrown when a card is not found.
CardNotImportedException
This exception is thrown when a card is not imported correctly.
CardPair<T>
This class is used to link the front and the back of the same card
CardPairTest
 
CardPosition
The class represent the position of the card in the playerField
CardType
This enumeration represents the type of a card.
CardTypeMismatchException
This exception is thrown when a card type mismatch occurs.
CardVisitor
Interface of the Visitor Design Pattern
CardVisitorImpl
The implementation of the CardVisitor used to implement the Visitor Design Pattern
Client
Abstract class representing a client in the network.
ClientHandlerInterface
Interface for handling client-side operations.
ClientInfo
Class representing the information of a client.
ClientMessage
 
ClientMessageType
This enumeration represents the type of message sent by the client.
ClientRMIInterface
The ClientRMIInterface is used by the server to communicate with the client.
Controller
This class is responsible for managing the game logic and interactions between the model and the view.
Deck<T>
This class represents a deck of resource cards in the game.
DeckIsEmptyException
This exception is thrown when a deck is empty.
Direction
This enumeration represents the directions.
DrawingField
This class represents the drawing field in the game.
DrawPosition
This enumeration represents the position from which a card is drawn.
ErrorAwareQueue
This class is a wrapper for the BlockingQueue used by the SocketClient to receive messages from the SocketClientMessageHandler The purpose of this class is to make the SocketClient able to receive error messages from the server
ErrorType
This enumeration represents the type of an error.
EventManager
The EventManager class is responsible for managing event listeners and notifications.
FilePathProvider
This interface provides the file paths for different types of cards in the game.
Game
This class represents the game.
GameAlreadyStartedException
This exception is thrown when a game is already started and a player tries to join.
GameEvent
 
GameHandler
Server side representation of a single game, used to implement the multiple games additional feature It contains the model and controller of a game
GameListener
The GameListener class implements the Listener interface for GameEvent.
GameLobbyController
This class is responsible for controlling the game lobby in the GUI.
GameNotFoundException
This exception is thrown when a game is not found.
GameStatus
This enumeration represents the status of a game.
GameValues
This class contains the values of the game that are used in multiple classes.
GoldCard
This class represents a gold card, which is a special type of card that requires a specific set of resources to be played.
GoldCardFactory
This class is responsible for creating a list of GoldCard instances.
GoldCardFactoryTest
 
GoldPointCondition
This enumeration represents the conditions of the gold cards.
GUI
This class is responsible for the GUI of the application.
GUIController
Initializes the scene by adding all player names and panes to their respective lists.
GUIScene
This enumeration represents the GUI scenes.
InspectedCardInfo
This class is used to store information about an inspected card in the game.
InvalidCardPositionException
This exception is thrown when the player tries to play a card in an invalid position.
InvalidConstructorDataException
This exception is thrown when the data passed to a constructor is invalid.
InvalidUsernameException
This exception is thrown when a username is invalid.
JoinGameScreenController
This class is responsible for controlling the join game screen in the GUI.
Listener<T>
The Listener interface defines a single method, update, which is used to update the state of an object when an event of type T occurs.
LobbyController
The LobbyController class is responsible for handling user interactions in the lobby scene of the GUI.
LoginScreenController
The LoginScreenController class is responsible for handling user interactions in the login screen of the GUI.
MainClient
The main class of the Client
MainGameScreenController
The MainGameScreenController class is responsible for handling user interactions in the main game screen of the GUI.
MainServer
The main class of the server
Marker
This enumeration represents the colors of a marker.
NoCardAddedException
This exception is thrown when a card is not added correctly to player hand.
NoneResourceException
This exception is thrown when the enumeration Resources is NONE
NotAvailableMarkerException
This exception is thrown when a marker is not available anymore.
NotEnoughPlayersException
This exception is thrown when there are not enough players to start a game.
NotExistingPlayerException
This exception is thrown when a player is not found.
NotTurnException
This exception is thrown when it's not the turn of the player.
ObjectiveCard
This class represents the objective card that has the three different objects (quill, inkwell, manuscript) as pattern to satisfy to obtain three points
PlayableCard
This class represents a started card, which is given to the player at the beginning of the game.
Player
This class represents the player
PlayerField
This class represents a player field.
PlayerHand
This class represents the hand of the player.
PointCalculator
This class is responsible for calculating the points of the game.
PositionalObjectiveCard
This class represents a positional objective card, which can be diagonal or L-shaped.
PositionalObjectiveCardFactory
This class is responsible for creating a list of PositionalObjectiveCard instances.
PositionalObjectiveCardFactoryTest
 
PositionalType
This enumeration represents the type of objective cards.
ProductionFilePathProvider
This class provides the file paths for different types of cards in the game.
RequirementsNotMetException
This exception is thrown when the requirements of a gold card are not met.
Resource
This enumeration represents the resources and the objects.
ResourceCard
This class represents a resource card, which is identified by a resource.
ResourceCardFactory
This class is responsible for creating a list of ResourceCard instances.
ResourceCardFactoryTest
 
ResourceObjectiveCard
This class represents a resource objective card, which requires the player to have a certain amount of a specific resource.
ResourceObjectiveCardFactory
This class is responsible for creating a list of ResourceObjectiveCard instances.
ResourceObjectiveCardFactoryTest
 
RMIClient
Class representing a client using RMI.
ScoreboardController
This class is responsible for controlling the scoreboard in the GUI.
Server
The Server class is responsible for managing the game server.
ServerDisconnectedException
This exception is thrown when the server is disconnected.
ServerMessage
 
ServerMessageType
This enumeration represents the type of messages that the server can send to the client.
ServerRMIInterface
The ServerRMIInterface is used by the client to communicate with the server.
Side
This enumeration represents the side of the card.
SocketClient
The SocketClient class extends the Client class and provides the implementation for a client that communicates with the server using sockets.
SocketClientHandler
Server side Class used to receive messages and sent messages to the SocketClient Each SocketClient has its own thread of SocketClientHandler This class implements ClientHandlerInterface, so it is effectively treated by the server as an instance of a client
SocketClientMessageHandler
Client side Class used to receive messages and sent messages to the Server Each SocketClient has its own thread of SocketClientMessageHandler
SocketConnectionHandler
This class is used by the server to accept SocketConnections
StarterCard
The class represent the starter card, witch the player have as first card in the playerField
StarterCardFactory
This class is responsible for creating a list of StarterCard instances.
StarterCardFactoryTest
 
TableTop
TableTop class is the class that contains the drawing field and all the players' fields.
TripleObjectiveCard
The class represent the ObjectiveCard with 3 different resources
TripleObjectiveCardFactory
This class is responsible for creating a list of TripleObjectiveCard instances.
TripleObjectiveCardFactoryTest
 
TUI
This class represents the Text User Interface (TUI) of the game.
UI
This abstract class represents the User Interface (UI) of the game.
UnlinkedCardException
This exception is thrown when a card is not linked with its other side.
View
This interface represents the View of the game.
ViewCLI
This class represents the Command Line Interface (CLI) view of the game.
ViewGUI
This class represents the GUI view of the game.
Visitable
Interface of the Visitor Design Pattern
WrongInputException
This exception is thrown when the input inserted by a user is wrong.
